result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Timothy J Ratliff in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 and Count #2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

**Court "administratively" ordered that any cash bail on deposit can be returned to the person who posted it.

Court ordered bail set at $50.00 cash with TURNOVER TO Justice Point Pretrial Services.  Conditions of release remain the same as previously ordered.

- NO FILE IN COURT - 

Defendant Timothy J Ratliff in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Projected Deferred Prosecution Agreement today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.
Parties are awaiting a response from drug treatment court AND are working out the details of the DPA.

Court addressed bail:  Bail is currently set at $350.00 cash.  Defense moves for a modification in bail to $50.00 cash.  State stipulates to $50.00 cash bail.  Based upon the stipulation of the parties, Court GRANTS defense's motion and ordered bail set at $50.00 cash with TURNOVER TO Justice Point Pretrial Services.  Conditions of release remain the same as previously ordered.

Case adjourned to 08-20-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea Hearing/DPA.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WAL-MART.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
